issues.title: Unexpected errors
issues.body:
If you load https://github.com/ceylon/ceylon-sdk/tree/57a70b8a77925bfb38f4a9cdb255c8e6b86fa757 you will get errors about:
- `package not found in imported modules: javax.transaction.xa (add module import to module descriptor of com.example.recovery)` in `DummyXAResource.java`, when the type exists, and the two following imports of the same package work.
- `package not found in imported modules: javax.transaction.xa (add module import to module descriptor of com.example.recovery)` although the module which provides `javax.transaction.xa` is `javax.transaction.api` and is shared by the `org.jboss.narayana.jta` module, which we share. So this error is not necessary. It does not occur in the CLI.
- If you add `shared import javax.transaction` to the `ceylon.transaction` module it will work, but it should not, since those packages are provided by `javax.transaction.api`, NOT `javax.transaction`.
- I get a `The Ceylon Java backend compiler failed abormally` error, but I have no idea why. There MUST be more details.

issues.title: Error markers not cleared
issues.body: When I correct an error in a ceylon file, the error marker disappears from the editor, but not the problems view.

issues.title: Build not triggered by editing of `module.ceylon` file
issues.body: Even when I remove a module import.

issues.title: Problem with wildcard import
issues.body:
In a .ceylon file, I have a wildcard import of the float package:

```
import ceylon.math.float { ... }
```

For an example, see https://github.com/PhiLhoSoft/Ceylon/blob/master/FirstSteps/source/org/philhosoft/sandbox/DartSynonyms.ceylon

When I start up Eclipse, using the latest official dev plugin, all the functions of this package are marked as unknown.  
If I replace the line with explicit imports:

```
import ceylon.math.float { floor, ceiling, random, pi, sin, cos }
```

the red marks disappear.  
The funny thing is that now, I can replace back this line with the wildcard one...

issues.title: duplicate class errors with structure-aware incremental build
issues.body:
In `ceylon-sdk`, I add 

```
 shared formal Boolean root1;
```

to `Path` in `ceylon.file`, and I get errors like:

```
duplicate class: ceylon.file.parsePath_
```

which require a full build.

issues.title: No popup, documentation, refactorings
issues.body:
I compile the IDE plugin from source using maven and install it into my normal eclipse (which is now Luna). The syntax highlighting and compilation work fine (compile errors underlined and error markers in gutter etc). But:
- None of the popups work (hover on error, documentation etc).
- The documentation view doesn't work and always says "Nothing selected in Ceylon editor".
- All the entries in the Refactor menu are greyed out

I seem to have nothing logged in the error log, nor anything printed to the console. 

If it's relevant, I'm using Fedora 19.

issues.title: Backend errors on a Ceylon file available in several projects,  are added in wrong project
Build done on the UI thread
issues.body: Open the SDK, edit `HashMap`, save, and observe that the build locks the UI thread until it's done. I'm pretty sure we should not be building on the UI thread.

issues.title: Completion after `.` pressed in doc comments
issues.body: I get completion in doc comments after a `.` is pressed, but only as the last character. For instance this will get completion: `"foo." Integer f;` but this will not: `"foo. " Integer f;`. Sounds like a one-off index check went wrong, but I've no clue where that check is made.

issues.title: Format selection cuts off last character
issues.body: If you format a selection, the last character of the surrounding node – typically the closing brace – is removed. Probably just a stupid off-by-one error.

issues.title: CCE in addChangeRefiningParametersProposal()
issues.body:
I got this while working on some Ceylon code for #843.
@gavinking : do you want me to work on it ? Or maybe you immediately know what's going on ?

issues.title: Run configuration for tests are not updated with new tests
issues.body:
I saw practice to write Ceylon tests as a series of top-level functions annotated with test.
It is nice (simpler than classical JUnit structure) but it leads to an unexpected problem: when I add a new test, and run again the test, via the Rerun Test button in the Ceylon Test view, or via the Run button of the main toolbar: the new test is happily skipped, leading to a blissful evergreen state...

I suppose the run configuration that is created when we do Run As > Ceylon Test takes a snapshot of the top-level items and runs only them, without updating them with the current state of the editor.
If we run the tests again with Run As > Ceylon Test, it will create a new run configuration, polluting the run space...

A workaround is to wrap the test methods in a class (the methods must be shared, then), which might be the best practice after all, as it allows to have same test method names in different files in the same package... And it allows to scope objects common to several tests.

I don't know if this behavior can be fixed (it can depend on Eclipse itself), but I leave this bug as reference for those stumbling on the same issue.

issues.title: Formatter should read config options
issues.body:
@tombentley just brought to my attention that despite my claim that

> [t]he formatter already reads the `.ceylon/config` file

in #987, that doesn’t actually seem to happen – we use

``` java
new CombinedOptions(format_.format$options(node),
    new Singleton<SparseFormattingOptions>
        (SparseFormattingOptions.$TypeDescriptor$, wsOptions))
```

and the default value of `format.options` is `FormattingOptions()`, so I don’t see where `configOptions` is supposed to come in.

Silly oversight.

issues.title: Spurious error when adding a method to an interface and its implementation
issues.body:
I have an interface I and an implementation C.
I add a new method to I: `shared formal void addStuff(Stuff s);`
Eclipse tells me the implementation is missing in C.
I type in C `add` then hit Ctrl+Space and choose at the bottom of the list the default implementation of the method.
Auto-completion does its job and add an implementation with an empty body.
I add some code in the body.
I get a red marker, with two notices:
- refines I.addStuff
- Method does not override or implement a method from a supertype
  A bit contradictory...
  If I clean the project, the error disappears.

Using Ceylon 1.1 with plugin from official dev channel.

Impossible to open modules and modules sometimes disappear in Hierachical Package Presentation
issues.body:
At least Ceylon projects in Eclipse (Ceylon Package Explorer) whose modules will refuse to open if I've set my Package Presentation to Hierarchical.    I can open the modules if I switch to Flat Package Presentation (the default setting in Eclipse).  In at least a couple of cases, I've noticed the entire module disappear entirely until I switched back to Flat.

To change the package presentation, in Ceylon Explorer, click the small upside-down triangle in the upper right-hand corner Package Presentation > Hierarchical.

Specifically, I see the module icons under the source folder but I can't expand them to show their contents and when I right-click Go Into is greyed out.  This is a recent development with the latest Ceylon builds. 

I don't have a set of scientific steps to reproduce this, but I tried creating a new project and creating a couple of modules.  In my most recent attempt, I created two modules, one of which had a second package nested under the main module project.    The module with the nested package disappeared.

I've attached an example Eclipse project to Google Groups ceylon-users under the thread "Ceylon IDE: Sometimes impossible to open modules in Hierachical Package Presentation"

issues.title: don't propose uninitialized/undeclared variables
issues.body: The IDE proposes all locals, even those which have not yet been declared/initialized. We should fix this, but probably requires support in the typechecker, which throws away that information.

issues.title: character encoding mismatch should not result in a modal popup
issues.body:
When `CeylonEncodingSynchronizer` notices a mismatch b/w the project encoding and `.ceylon/config`, it pops up a modal dialog. This isn't consistent with Eclipse conventions.

Instead, it should add an error to the problems view, and offer the current two possible solutions as quick fixes.

issues.title: copy/paste from string literal to string literal should not add \ escapes
Only "touching" the Ceylon properties page enables Ceylon builder
issues.body: If I have a normal Java project and go into the project properties and so much as click the "Ceylon Compiler" page, if I then click "Ok" (doesn't matter if it's on that page or on any other) the Ceylon builder will be enabled.

issues.title: Dependant projects, brittle build sequence
issues.body:
Reproduced on Windows and Linux with 1.1 (master)
Exactly the same errors on both OS.

I've created a GitHub repos that contains two Ceylon dependant projects (project `upstream` and project `downstream`).

Use `File > Import > Git > Projects from GIT > Clone URI`
with URI :
`https://github.com/sgalles/Ceylon-dependant.git`
and keep `import existing projects`
Now you should see two Ceylon projects `upstream` and `downstream`, with `downstream` that depends on `upstream`.
They should compile at this step.

Now, _close Eclipse_

In both projects directories delete the following directories :

```
.ceylon
.exploded
classes
modules
resource
```

(if they exist, of course)

_Reopen Eclipse_

Now, the build of project `downstream` is going to try to compile some parts of project `upstream` and it is going to leave it in a very strange state at the end of the build (sometimes project `upstream` does not even have a proper `modules` directory)

Anyway, at the end of the inital build, I see the following errors in project `downstream`

```
cannot find module source artifact foo-1.0.0(.car|.jar|.src)
    - dependency tree: bar/1.0.0 -> foo/1.0.0
package not found in imported modules: foo (add module import to module descriptor of bar)
type does not exist: Foo
```

And now if you try to work in project `upstream` (touch a file !) you're going to trigger a storm of compiler errors.

issues.title: Module with resource does not have it generated correctly from eclipse
issues.body: Im using windows environment and for example locale module does not have the resources inside the car, if I create it by "ant" with the command "ant clean publish" the it works nicely (the car does have the resources inside it).

issues.title: Java source file cross-reference incremental build broken according to  classpath order
issues.body:
- **Given** the following situation :
  - a Ceylon project P1 depends on a Ceylon project P2, 
  - P2 contains a Java class J2,
  - P1 contains a Ceylon class C1 that imports and uses J2,
  - The Ceylon classpath container entry is  _before_ the P2 project entry in the P1 classpath,
- **If** the J2 class is renamed without changing the J2 source file (which produces and error of course),
- **Then** the P1 project doesn't report any error in the C1 class though it should.

If the Ceylon classpath container entry is  _after_ the P2 project entry in the P1 classpath, the error is correctly reported.

issues.title: Export module does not export its resources
issues.body: Try to export locale module and you should notice that it does not export its resources.

issues.title: toplevel interfaces/classes with different name to the file can't be found by compiler
issues.body: Ah hah! I just realized that the Ceylon compiler, at least in the IDE, has problems dealing with Java multiple classes defined in the same file. It simply doesn't find the class when it's name is not the same as the source file in which it is defined. My suspicion is that this is likely IDE-specific, but I'm not certain of that.

issues.title: Can’t close Ceylon Explorer
issues.body:
The “new” Ceylon Explorer cannot be closed – its tab has no ‘×’ button, and right-clicking on it does nothing.

As far is I can recall, it’s been like this since it replaced the “old” Ceylon Explorer.

issues.title: StackOverflowError on save
issues.body:
At the moment, I’m getting a `StackOverflowError` on every save, in every project:

> at com.redhat.ceylon.eclipse.core.model.ModuleDependencies$1DependencyAnalyzer.isRootExportedBy([ModuleDependencies.java:505](https://github.com/ceylon/ceylon-ide-eclipse/blob/fdad0d0592b1439533d4cccc7b137c1140fb95e6/plugins/com.redhat.ceylon.eclipse.ui/src/com/redhat/ceylon/eclipse/core/model/ModuleDependencies.java#L505))
> <sup>Generated by [linkStackTrace](http://lucaswerkmeister.github.io/linkStackTrace/)</sup>

(Yes, that’s the entire loop. The final overflow happens elsewhere, but that doesn’t matter.)

This has happened and vanished before, so I don’t think it’s very well reproducible :-/ I hope it’s still fixable?

issues.title: Extract function and assignments
IDE does not copy resources where JS runtime can find them
issues.body: I assume that the JS compiler copies resources to the repo directory, is that right, @chochos, but this is not happening in the IDE. Any idea, @davidfestal?

issues.title: > decoration for uncommitted modules
issues.body: Eclipse places a > decoration on resources with uncommitted changes. This is not visible on module nodes in the Ceylon Explorer.

issues.title: compilation error in SDK
issues.body: Currently there is a compilation error in the SDK that does not occur when the SDK is compiled from the command line. @davidfestal would you take a look, please?

issues.title: missing model for ArrayList.growthFactor in binary module
issues.body: The model for `ArrayList` does not contain any member representing the parameter `growthFactor` when `ceylon.collection` is imported as a binary dependency.

issues.title: Go To Refined Declaration broken for shortcut refinement
issues.body: Go To Refined Declaration is disabled for the shortcut refinement syntax.

issues.title: Formatter can use outdated tokens, losing changes
issues.body:
Since the formatter uses the tokens from the `CeylonParseController`, when those tokens are outdated, changes can be lost. I find that this most often happens when formatting on save, because I then usually hit Ctrl+S immediately after I’m done with editing, but it can probably happen in regular formatting, too.

I think we need to somehow specify that formatting depends on lexing.

issues.title: “Move to a new source file” concats imports without separating commas
Auto-complete of inherited class attributes, mistakenly auto-import the attribute
Rename produces double name in shortcut refinement syntax

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
refactoring and attempted solution for #1020
enable the editor hiding code

issues.title: 'Organize import' during a clean/build, imports types from 'ceylon.language'
issues.body:
Start with this code :

``` ceylon
shared String foo() {return nothing;}
```

Now, launch a _clean_ of the project...and... during the rebuild...immediately hit `Ctrl+Shit+O` !!!
If you're fast enough you get :

``` ceylon
import ceylon.language {
    shared,
    String,
    nothing
}

shared String foo() {return nothing;}
```

(Note : tested on a Windows machine)

issues.title: IDE insists on finding a source artifact for a jar in repo
issues.body:
I don't know if this can be reproduced in a more general context. It happens during the setup of an Android project with Ceylon. 
I get this compilation error in the IDE 

```
cannot find module source artifact android-19.src
    - dependency tree: com.example.foo/1.0.0 -> android/19
```

Of course, there is an easy workaround : if I create a dummy  android-19.src file, the error goes away.
In the context of Ceylon+Android it is a regression, I had never seen this error before.

This is how to reproduce :
- create a new Android application (new _Android Application Project_, make sure to choose _Target SDK API19_ and _Compile With API19_, For the type of activity choose _Empty Activity_)
- Enable the Ceylon Builder for this project
- Change the classpath order as requested by the IDE (Ceylon libraries before Android libraries)
- Create a Ceylon module in the main package of your Android application
- add the Ceylon import for the android jar in the module (`shared import android "19"`)

You get the `cannot find module source artifact android-19.src` error.

issues.title: Packages for ceylon.language.meta and ceylon.language.meta.model have null Unit
issues.body: The `Package` objects for `ceylon.language.meta` and `ceylon.language.meta.model` (but not `ceylon.language.meta.declaration`!) have null `Unit`s. Which means that we can't navigate to the descriptor, or get the doc hover.

issues.title: Renaming manually a java static method crashes at execution
issues.body:
In a fresh project, create a java class and a ceylon file

``` java
public class JavaUtil {
    public static void f(){}
}
```

``` ceylon
// run.ceylon
import org.app9 {JavaUtil {f}}
shared void run() {
    f();
}
```

Save and run, it should be OK.

Now rename JavaUtil.f manually in two steps:
- rename _manually_ `f` to `f0` in `JavaUtil`;
- save it - `run.ceylon` has 2 errors;
- rename _manually_ `f` to `f0` in `run.ceylon`;
- save it - no error any more;
- run `run()` from Eclipse (as Java application), and you get in console:

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)

    at com.redhat.ceylon.launcher.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:21)
Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.app9.JavaUtil.f0()V
    at org.app9.run_.run(run.ceylon:5)
    at org.app9.run_.main(run.ceylon)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:601)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.SecurityActions.invokeRunInternal(SecurityActions.java:58)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.SecurityActions.invokeRun(SecurityActions.java:48)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.AbstractRuntime.invokeRun(AbstractRuntime.java:85)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.AbstractRuntime.execute(AbstractRuntime.java:146)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.AbstractRuntime.execute(AbstractRuntime.java:130)
    at ceylon.modules.Main.execute(Main.java:69)
    at ceylon.modules.Main.main(Main.java:42)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
```

Luna: Ceylon Explorer adds toplevel node for working set
issues.body:
On Eclipse Luna, the Ceylon Explorer adds a toplevel node for the currently selected working set (if any):
![screenshot from 2014-06-28 20 23 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2346599/3421520/6e474390-fef1-11e3-9588-31331b35bdd7.png)
If you select multiple working sets, you get multiple toplevel nodes.
JDT’s Package Explorer doesn’t do that, so I have no idea where it’s coming from.

(The other two problems in the screenshot – dark text for `ceylon.formatter`, and missing Git info for `ceylon.ast` – are present in the Package Explorer as well.)

issues.title: 'Export Ceylon Module to Module Repository' broken by 'Perform a clean build'
issues.body:
Using the latest published dev IDE (1.1.0.v20140411-0943-Final)

The `Export Ceylon Module to Module Repository` feature does not work if the option `Perform a clean build before exporting` is checked.

If the option is checked, the directories for the modules are created, but the `.car` is not exported. 
Once, I've also witnessed a car that was exported but was incomplete (missing classes in the car)

Somehow it seems that the clean/build operation and the export operation arent' sequential and the export operation starts too soon (my wild guess...)

issues.title: Internal errors when a project has a local class and another depends on it
issues.body:
If a project (say, `org.mydep`) has a local class: 

``` ceylon
class MyTest() {
    void myTest() {
        class TestClass(shared String field0, shared String field1) {}
    }
}
```

and another project (say, `org.myapp`) depends on it, a "Multiple problems have occured" shows up when starting eclipse:

```
Warming up completion processor for org.myapp
An internal error occurred during: "Warming up completion processor for org.myapp".
2
```

and

```
Warming up completion processor for org.mydep
An internal error occurred during: "Warming up completion processor for org.mydep".
2
```

Same error when recompiling all (menu Project/Clean, select all, clean all, with 'Build Automatically' selected).
If I remove `TestClass` parameters, compilation is OK.
Sometimes I also had a java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundException.

Full workspace:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B09FzhUz_CgbX3B4M3dmSVJuYnM/edit?usp=sharing

Copy with imports folded should copy imports contents too
modules/packages show up multiple times in Ceylon explorer
issues.body:
If you have a module with at least three parts in the name (e. g. `com.example.helloworld`) in the Ceylon Explorer and enable the “hierarchical” package representation, you get this tree:

```
[module] com.example
    [package] com.example
        [package] com.example.helloworld
            module.ceylon, package.ceylon
    [package] com.example.helloworld
        module.ceylon, package.ceylon
```

and after playing around with it for a bit (creating a new module `foo.bar` for testing), I even got an additional

```
[module] com.example.helloworld
    [package] com.example.helloworld
        module.ceylon, package.ceylon
```

and after switching to “flat” package representation, the `com.example com.example` subtree from above vanished, but I still have the package twice. Refreshing doesn’t help. (I can’t close and re-open the Ceylon Explorer because for some reason you can’t close it, which is another issue.)

issues.title: Use workspace default line delimiters
issues.body:
In the workspace preferences (Window / Preferences / General / Workspace / "New text file line delimiter") one can define the default line delimiter for new text files. All other eclipse plugins that I have used adhere to the defined value there, except for Ceylon IDE. 

I am on Windows and thus the default line delimiter is `\r\n`. I changed that to Unix line delimiters `\n`, but Ceylon still creates new files with `\r\n` delimiters. My current workaround is to change file delimiters for every new file I create via File / Convert Line Delimiters To / Unix, but that's annoying, if you have to create a lot of files.

issues.body:
``` ceylon
object o satisfies Iterable<Anything> {}
```

The Ceylon IDE will suggest the quick fixes
- Refine formal inherited members
- Make 'o' abstract

However, the second one doesn’t make sense, as objects can’t be abstract.

Related to #333.

issues.title: interface from binary archive has missing scope
issues.body:
I was wondering why wiki-style links weren't working in the documentation hover for a binary archive, and I tracked it down to `Interface.getScope()` returning null. Apparently the model loader never initializes it.

I "fixed" the problem by hacking in:

```
klass.setScope(klass.getContainer());
```

to `AbstractModelLoader:1660`, but I've no idea what the real fix should be, and what other cases there are to consider.

@davidfestal Would you take a look, please?

issues.title: imports and Create class quick fix
issues.body: The "Create class" quick fix doesn't add imports needed by the refined member signatures it produces.

issues.title: Make Receiver refactoring and declaration-style named args
issues.body: Make Receiver works fine for regular named arguments, but not for declaration-style args.

issues.title: value name completion after abbreviated type expression
Peek Definition broken in dirty editor
issues.body: If you do Peek Definition on a declaration the file you're currently editing, it pulls the text direct from the underlying file, not from the document.

issues.title: CSS to suppress <hr/>s not working on windows 8
issues.body:
I have:

```
hr { padding: 2px; border:0; }
```

But I guess this doesn't work in IE :-(

issues.title: Embedded module repo not being used
issues.body: Initial issue description was wrong. Problem has nothing to do with windows. Rather, this issue is that the default repo is simply not being used anymore.

issues.title: flashing in documentation view
issues.body: When changing the selection, the documentation view flashes white.

issues.title: Peek Definition very broken on Windows
issues.body: There are multiple bugs in this thing when running on Windows 8.

issues.title: Open Ceylon Declaration broken for a project with no modules
issues.body: Ooops, previous description was wrong. Bug has nothing to do with windows, it is to do with `ModuleManager().getCompiledModules()` not returning the default module. @davidfestal is that expected?

issues.title: Extract and inline quick fixes discard \i, \I
NPE when compiling 2 projects if one has 2 source directories
issues.body:
The first project (app0) has 2 source directories containing a module org.app0:

```
 source/
     org/app0/module.ceylon (with default content)
     org/app0/package.ceylon (with default content)
     org/app0/run.ceylon  (with default content)
 test-source/
     org/app0/module.ceylon (empty)
     org/app0/package.ceylon (empty)
```

The second project (app1) depends on app0:

```
 source/
     /org/app1/module.ceylon 
     /org/app1/package.ceylon (with default content)
     /org/app1/run.ceylon  (with default content)
```

and /org/app1/module.ceylon contains:

```
module org.app1 "1.0.0" {
    import org.app0 "1.0.0";
}
```

When you clean + compile all in Eclipse, you get a NPE dialog.

(BTW, if you copy/paste a module from source/ to test-source/, you get another NPE).

issues.title: Incremental build broken for java toplevel object or methods in the same project
really irritating log messages
issues.body: The backend logs parse errors to `System.err` and this we get really annoying log messages in the IDE every time you save. We should fix this. Fix is really in the compiler back end, AFAICS.

issues.title: autoindentation when splitting parameterized or braced lists across lines
Move Out and Make Receiver should fix type expressions
issues.body: Move Out needs to remove the qualifier, Make Receiver needs to add it.

issues.title: Auto-indentation bug with interpolated strings
issues.body:
``` ceylon
print("Key available:``selectedKey.acceptable``, connectable: ``selectedKey.connectable``,<PRESS ENTER HERE>");
```

I expect to be lined up below the opening `"` but I am indented to the end of the first line. This doesn't feel right.

issues.title: Completion issue
hierarchy popup on Map does not show HashMap, TreeMap, etc
issues.body: When I'm browsing the source of `ceylon.collection`, and I navigate to the definition of `Map` in `ceylon.language`, and activate the hierarchy popup, or the Ceylon Type Hierarchy view, I don't see the subtypes of `Map` defined by the SDK.

issues.title: Override method assist doesn’t completely escape arguments
new project wizard not cleaning up after cancel
issues.body: The New Ceylon Project wizard leaves a temp directory lying around if you cancel it. It should remove it.

issues.title: hover and go to navigation broken for imported modules imported from other project
issues.body: When I'm in a module descriptor that imports a module from another project, hovering the `import` or attempting to navigate to it doesn't work.

issues.title: Go To navigation and Open Ceylon Declaration broken for unflatten()
issues.body: Navigating to `unflatten()` takes me to its Java impl. Attempting to open it with Open Ceylon Declaration takes me nowhere.

issues.title: need to use a DocumentRewriteSession in proposals that add imports
issues.body: Completion proposals that add imports currently result in two Undo actions. Need to fix that.

issues.title: rename alias quick assist broken for member aliases
issues.body: Renaming an alias for a member import doesn't work.

issues.title: clean imports strips out member aliases
SharedAnnotation$annotation$ etc show up in proposals lists
issues.body:
Annotation classes like `SharedAnnotation$annotation$` are now showing up in the autocompletion proposal lists. Of course I could filter them out, but that would just be papering over the real problem which is that the model loader should ignore them. Aren't they marked `@Ignore` by the compiler?

@davidfestal Could you take a quick look, please?

issues.title: Source attachments open with Java editor
issues.body:
When you open a class file that has a Ceylon source attachment, the source is opened in the Java editor.
### How to reproduce
- In any Ceylon project, expand “Ceylon Language Module - 1.0.0” > “ceylon.language-1.0.0.car” > “ceylon.language” > “abstract_.class”, **or**
- When debugging, step into a method or function in `ceylon.language` that’s implemented in Ceylon (for example, `List.equals` of `print({1} == {1})`)

![Screenshot](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2346599/2093218/b3c7a344-8eb5-11e3-9478-801aef8dad49.png) – as you can see, annotations aren’t colored, multi-line (doc) strings don’t work, etc.

issues.title: parameters not held in members list of class
issues.body: `Class.getDirectMember()` should return parameters of the class. Ditto for `Method`s. Currently, this call returns null when given the name of an un-`shared` parameter, which results in the need for [this ugly workaround](https://github.com/ceylon/ceylon-ide-eclipse/commit/806f5d259e384da8df18a0ea4b5ccd8fcbe9677e).

issues.title: rework convert to named arguments quick assist
issues.body: Currently it's really tricky to get the caret in the right place to get access to this quick fix.

issues.title: Avoid keywords in imports
issues.body:
Hi,
 I have a package ending in ".out" which needs backslashy protection when importing typed from it. Currently the auto-importer creates syntax errors in that case.

I suspect this is trivial but I can provide more information if desired.

issues.title: build broken when a module archive is removed from the disk
issues.body:
When removing on disk some of the Ceylon module binary archives used inside the Ceylon classpath container, we can obtain errors on Java files that use Ceylon, and those errors cannot be removed until a module descriptor is changed or the project is closed/reopened. Even clean builds don't remove the errors.
In such a case we should reset and refresh the classpath container, which is current not done.

issues.title: navigate to source of XxxxArray in java.lang
issues.body:
I now have working doc hover for all the `XxxxArray` classes we added to `java.lang`, but I can't navigate to their source code.

@davidfestal would you take a look please, surely it's gotta be an easy fix now.

issues.title: lots of NPEs in IDE when using java.lang.ByteArray, BooleanArray, etc
issues.body: When I use the special array stuff hacked into `java.lang`, I get NPEs, since `module.getArtifact()` is `null` for the module `java.base`.

issues.title: refinement proposed for member completion
issues.body:
Given:

```
class Bar() {
    Object x = nothing;
    x.str
```

Autocompletion proposes a refinement of `Bar.string`.

issues.title: when compilation of one type fails, lots of errors in code which depends on that type
Support for hyphen/dash character for ceylon source filenames in new source file wizard
issues.body:
if I try to create a new ceylon source file from the IDE new ceylon source file wizard, it prevents me from creating it with an hyphen/dash in it.
I have the following error: `Please enter a legal compilation unit name.`

However, if I rename a ceylon source file in the IDE, It lets met put a `-` in the name (I think it's because it's the file/resource rename popup, not a ceylon source one)
With that file, compilation and execution are working fine.

issues.title: changes to supertypes of a class not reflected after incremental build
issues.body: With David's latest work, editing a class and changing its supertypes is not reflected until you do a clean build.

issues.title: autocompletion does not see newly-written toplevel declarations until saved
issues.body: If I write a new toplevel declaration, don't save the editor, and then attempt to autocomplete its name in the same editor, it is not proposed. Once I save the editor, it appears.

issues.title: Error spans in .ceylon file for project with no Ceylon builder
issues.body:
When I open a `.ceylon` file in the language module, or in some other project with no Ceylon builder, I see a bunch of error spans. I also experience really slow performance editing the file.

FTR, this is a result of @davidfestal's recent changes.

issues.title: “Duplicate declaration name” on save
issues.body:
With the new performance improvements in the IDE, I get “duplicate declaration error”s each time I save a Ceylon source file. I ain’t even mad, because cleaning the project and rebuilding it is _still_ faster than building was before these improvements – great work, thank you very much – but it probably should still be fixed.

I’m currently on bd80ca5 (`master` at the time of writing).

issues.title: Problem resolving module path if path contains a space.
issues.body:
Environment:
Windows 7
Eclipse Kepler Service Release 1
Ceylon IDE 1.0.0.v20131111-1241-Final

IDE did not report any problems creating the module, but when attempted to run from Eclipse it reported that the module could not be found.  The path to the module (in an external repository) had a space.  When the space was removed the problem was resolved.

issues.title: tag error in module.xml when exporting jar file into module from Eclipse
issues.body:
Environment:
Windows 7
Eclipse Kepler Service Release 1
Ceylon IDE 1.0.0.v20131111-1241-Final

When exporting a jar file into module, the module.xml file is invalid.  The termination module tag is incorrect (modules rather than module).

issues.title: after Extract Function refactoring, bogus errors in problems view
issues.body: With the latest code, and the changes _since_ the most recent development built, calling Extract Function results in a broken incremental build, with bogus errors displayed in the problems view, and broken internal state of the `ProjectSourceFile`.

issues.title: Extract function removes “top-level” comments
Don’t verify [[links]] inside code blocks
issues.body:
For example:

``` ceylon
"Converts
     bla {@link bar baz} blub
 into
     bla [[baz|bar]] blub"
String convertLink(String text) { return nothing; }
```

I don’t care that `bar` does not exist, it’s just an example. It’s not going to be linked anyways.

This should also apply to: 

``` ceylon
"""this is a doc comment: `"reference a [[Clazz]]"`"""
```

<sup>(interesting, both the Github and Ceylon Web Runner syntax highlighters can’t handle a string inside a verbatim string.)</sup>

(Of course, this is only a _very_ minor issue/annoyance, and probably not very relevant to most users.)

issues.title: Extract function broken for expressions appearing in fat arrow function dec.
issues.body:
Given:

```
function foo(Float bar) => bar*2;
```

Selecting and extracting `bar*2` does not create a function with `bar` as a parameter.

issues.title: cross-project navigation
issues.body: When I make add a reference to the ceylon-sdk project to my own project, and attempt to navigate to a type in `ceylon.collection` using command-click, it doesn't work. Nor are types from `ceylon.collection` proposed until I have used them at least once. However, strangely, hover _does_ work.

issues.title: incremental build of code in module completely broken
issues.body:
In @davidfestal's branch editing a simple hello world belonging to a module does not result in recompilation. Incremental compilation of stuff in the default package _does_ work, however.

Unfortunately this behavior calls into question the resolution to several other recent bugs. We'll have to re-test everything once this one is fixed :-/

issues.title: navigating to Array
issues.body: Command-clicking on `Array` takes me to the Java source code definition instead of the Ceylon definition.

issues.title: invoking Array
issues.body:
With David's changes, this code:

```
void foobarbaz() {
    Array("hello", "world");
}
```

results in:

```
ambiguous invocation of overloaded method or class: there must be exactly one overloaded declaration of Array that accepts the given argument types (String, String)
```

It seems to ignore an `@Ignore`.

issues.title: Rename module + Update fully qualified names breaks {module,package}.ceylon
issues.body:
How to reproduce:
1. create a tmp project+module (or use the one I’m sure you already have)
2. select the tmp module
3. open the “Rename” dialog, e. g. by pressing F2
4. enter a new name, e. g. tmp2
5. make sure the checkbox “Update fully qualified names in non-Java text files (forces preview)” is checked and the “File name patterns: ” are set to `*`
6. click “Preview”, then “OK”
Result:
The module and package files now have a wrong module/package name: For “tmp” → “tmp2”, it’s “tmp22”.

I assume the problem is that .ceylon files are considered non-Java text files somewhere, but the issue still happens if you rename the module to a disjoint name (like “blub”), so it’s not a simple search-and-replace that replaces a part of the already updated name.

issues.title: pasting/autocompleting results in dupe imports of Java declarations
issues.body: When I paste or autocomplete text with an imported Java declaration, the import gets duped.

issues.title: compilation error on incremental build after startup
issues.body:
In one file I have:

```
void run() {
    foo {};
}
```

And in a separate file:

```
void foo(Boolean boolean=true) {}
```

If I force an incremental build of the first file _immediately after startup_, I get this error:

```
incompatible types
  required: ceylon.language.Boolean
  found:    boolean
```

This error hangs around until I force a Clean build. After that incremental builds work fine.

issues.title: Can’t run the Ceylon test runner from the IDE
issues.body:
This is a weird one. When I run the Ceylon test runner from the IDE, I get the following error:

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    [snip 3]
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.launcher.Launcher.run(Launcher.java:89)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.launcher.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:21)
Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: ceylon.language.ArraySequence.$getArray$()[Ljava/lang/Object;
    at ceylon.test.internal.TestRunnerImpl.initExecutors$priv$(TestRunnerImpl.ceylon:34)
    at ceylon.test.internal.TestRunnerImpl.<init>(TestRunnerImpl.ceylon:44)
    at ceylon.test.createTestRunner_.createTestRunner(TestRunner.ceylon:52)
    at ceylon.test.createTestRunner_.createTestRunner(TestRunner.ceylon)
    at test.ceylon.formatter.run_.run(run.ceylon:3)
    at test.ceylon.formatter.run_.main(run.ceylon)
    [snip 3]
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.SecurityActions.invokeRunInternal(SecurityActions.java:61)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.SecurityActions.invokeRun(SecurityActions.java:51)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.AbstractRuntime.invokeRun(AbstractRuntime.java:89)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.AbstractRuntime.execute(AbstractRuntime.java:141)
    at ceylon.modules.api.runtime.AbstractRuntime.execute(AbstractRuntime.java:126)
    at ceylon.modules.Main.execute(Main.java:69)
    at ceylon.modules.Main.main(Main.java:42)
    [snip 3]
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
    at org.jboss.modules.Module.run(Module.java:270)
    at org.jboss.modules.Main.main(Main.java:294)
    at ceylon.modules.bootstrap.CeylonRunTool.run(CeylonRunTool.java:208)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.common.tools.CeylonTool.run(CeylonTool.java:343)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.common.tools.CeylonTool.execute(CeylonTool.java:283)
    ... 6 more
```

Here’s [tool.ceylon, line 81](https://github.com/ceylon/ceylon-sdk/blob/master/source/com/redhat/ceylon/test/tool.ceylon#L81), and here’s [ArraySequence.java, line 784](https://github.com/ceylon/ceylon.language/blob/master/runtime/ceylon/language/ArraySequence.java#L784), where `$getArray()$` is definitely defined (and I see the same source code if I open the Ceylon Language Module from the build path in Eclipse).

This issue occurs both with the IDE from the official update site and with an IDE built from current source; it happens both with the shipped `${ceylon.repo}` system repository and a `~/.ceylon/repo` built from current source; and it happens both when I run as Ceylon Java Application and when I run as Ceylon Test. However, the tests run fine from the command line.

I’m not sure what’s happening here. I suspect that some binaries are outdated; however, I don’t understand which binaries that ship with the IDE would still be used if I run as Ceylon Java Application (to not use the built-in test integration) _and_ use my own system repo (which can run the tests from the command line).

issues.title: after Correct Indent and Save, error in editor
Open Ceylon or Java Type very slow first time
issues.body:
With David's latest work, the Open Ceylon or Java Type dialog is extremely slow first time round. Indeed it is so slow that it looks broken, since it also doesn't show any kind of progress. If the slowness is unavoidable, we should at least either:

- add proper progress reporting.

issues.title: type hierarchy all messed up
issues.body: With David's latest changes, the type hierarchy is broken, as reported by @ncorai right [here](https://github.com/ceylon/ceylon-ide-eclipse/issues/728#issuecomment-29124544).

issues.title: errors in project that compiles to both JVM and JS
issues.body:
With David's latest changes, I can't compile to both backends.

I get:

```
cannot call Java declarations in Javascript
```

When calling any function in `ceylon.language`.

issues.title: on clean builds, shortcut refinement in binary module gone from model
issues.body:
Given:

```
import ceylon.html {
    Html,
    html5,
    Head,
    Body
}

class Basic() extends Html(html5, Head(), Body()) {}
```

This compiles just fine on an incremental build. But after a Clean, I get:

```
formal member tag of Node not implemented in class hierarchy
```

This is incorrect, because `Html` implements `tag` using shortcut refinement.

The code compiles fine from the command line compiler.

Originally reported by @DiegoCoronel in ceylon/ceylon-compiler#1461.

issues.title: Ceylon project wizard suggests wrong source folder
issues.body: By default, the wizard proposes `/src` instead of Ceylon's recommended `/source`.

issues.title: New Project wizard when 1.8 JRE is selected
issues.body:
Hi
I installed Ceylon IDE into my Eclipse 4.3 today and wanted to create a Hello World Project using the Wizard. I get to step 3 (of 6) "Create a Ceylon project".

I chose "Use default JRE" on the first page of the "New Ceylon Project" Wizard which selects my Java 1.8 JRE. When chlicking "Finish", I get an error which says "Please select a Java 1.7 JRE" (bug #754 ). This behavior is Ok for e.g. a Java 1.6 JRE.
If I click "Next" instead of "Finish" and click "Finish" on another page of this wizard, nothing happens. No visible note to the user that anything is wrong. The error should be visible on every single wizard page.

issues.title: Can’t open the Ceylon editor
issues.body:
When I try to open a ceylon file, I get Eclipse’s error panel instead:

Error message: “Failed to create the part's controls”
Exception: “java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument not valid”
Stacktrace: http://pastebin.com/a61SZwvy

I can still open `module.ceylon` and `package.ceylon`, and they have syntax highlighting and everything.

I’m currently on 1712386 (`master` at the time of writing this); before I updated the IDE, I was on ba38331. I’ll do a bisect now to try and find the bad commit.

issues.title: pasting less than a line of text should not trigger correct indentation
hierarchy popup does not show subtypes defined in source files in project!
issues.body: The hierarchy popup _only_ seems to show subtypes for stuff in binary archives. Not for subtypes defined in the current project source.

issues.title: dependencies to java modules in ceylon-sdk
issues.body: The ceylon-sdk project does not build in the IDE because of packages not found in Java dependencies.

issues.title: Ceylon test plugin issues
issues.body:
In Ceylon IDE 0.6.1, Windows 8, Eclipse Kepler SR1,
1) When using the Rerun Test button after changing some code that still results in a failed test, the Console output changes but the Failure Trace still shows the previous result (I tried with and without filtering applied). Same problem if I select a function in the editor and choose Run As -> Ceylon Test in the contextual menu.

2) When double-clicking on a line in the Failure Trace, it doesn't open the Ceylon source file and bring up the corresponding line in the editor. While I can get that from the Console, it seems it should work in the Failure Trace too.

3) Although there is a Test Result Comparison button, double clicking on the AssertComparisonException line in the Failure Trace could bring up the same result as a convenience.

issues.title: Auto-indent fails to account for empty lines
issues.body:
I for one like to separate my code into sections to enhance redability, especially in overlong unit tests. And I don't like trailing spaces or tabs.

As a consequence, auto-indent left justifies everyline afterwards, sometimes overruling my manual indentation (if I paste some code at the end of an existing line, for instance).

issues.title: Inconsistent/broken editor behavior for files in imported modules
issues.body:
In CeylonIDE M6, certain types in the ceylon.language module have their source code displayed in Ceylon, others in Java (when clicking in the explorer tree to open a file):

I. a) The Java-displayed files (e.g. ArraySequence) appear in the Java editor and of course expose Java actions (e.g. Ctrl+T brings a Quick Type Hierarchy view).

b) The Ceylon-displayed files (e.g. Anything and Object) also appear in the Java editor and expose Java actions but with varying degree of success (Ctrl+T displays no subtypes for Anything whereas it works fine for Object).

II. Opening Ceylon files through "Open Ceylon Declaration" opens the files in the Ceylon editor.
a) For ceylon.language files, certain actions such as alt+S to Find Subtypes work but navigation by Ctrl+LMB click doesn't.
b) For other modules, such as ceylon.time, the IDE is obviously not loading the rest of the module since actions work for ceylon.language types but not for types within the current module. Of course, Ctrl+LMB click navigation is broken there too.

issues.title: .ceylon/config file created for project with no Ceylon builder
issues.body: The IDE should check if the Ceylon builder is enabled before creating a `.ceylon/config` when you change the character encoding. In my case, it creating a `config` file for the `ceylon-lang.org` project.

issues.title: Fix DocLink rename refactoring and autocompletion
issues.body: see ceylon/ceylon-spec#820

issues.title: Export Ceylon Module
issues.body:
Remember last used "target module repozitory".

I always have "http://modules.ceylon-lang.org/test" selected.

issues.title: Rename refactoring only works once
issues.body:
When I have renamed a variable and I hit "Rename" on another variable in the same file then my previous refactoring is undone and I am presented with the previous renaming dialog again.

Also, the first renamed variable stays highlighted forever, no matter where I put my cursor

Seems like the editor remains in some kind of dirty state after renaming. When I close and reopen the editor between refactorings, all works well.

issues.title: Open Declaration only works in my own code
issues.body: "Open Declaration" (F3) only works in ceylon files in my workspace. When I open some class in ceylon.lang and then try to navigate to its superclass using F3, nothing happens.

issues.title: Indentation following newline
issues.body:
With the caret at the point show I press enter:

```
void f(Integer i)
        => 1;/*HERE*/
```

and the editor does not indent the new line (good). But in this case:

```
void f(
    Integer i)
        => 1;/*HERE*/
```

the editor indents the new line one level (4 spaces) (because that's how much the declaration of the parameter `i` is indented). I expected no indentation.

A similar thing happens for this:

```
void f(
    Integer i) {/*HERE*/
```

issues.title: Importing modules which in turn import another version of ceylon.language creates lots of errors
issues.body:
At least I think it's related to versions of ceylon.language:
- Nuke the SDK from the local repo: `$ rm -rf ~/.ceylon/repo/ceylon/*`
- Start the latest `0.6.1` Ceylon IDE
- Create a module
- Import `ceylon.json/0.6` (will be resolved from Herd unless in cache)

I get lots of errors on lots of nodes, that stem from the language module not being available, which is weird because it is, and it's the right one, but something seems to get confused because perhaps the 0.6 SDK explicitly imports another version of `ceylon.language`?

issues.title: Run as: Ceylon Javascript Module only accept method named "run"
issues.body:
Trying to run any shared toplevel method with Run As: Ceylon Javascript Module with a name different from "run" does not work:

```
The specified method test$js does not exist or is not shared in the js/1.0.0 module
```

issues.body:
I get:

```
The specified method "hello$testable" does not exist or is not shared in the testable/1.0.0 module
```

trying to run `hello()`.

issues.title: type parameters have funny icons in autocompletion list
issues.body: For some reason type parameters look like fields.

issues.title: bug in outline view import list
issues.body:
The outline view sometimes doesn't refresh the list of imports when switching between editors. That's because the id for the node is just plain `@importslist` with no kind of qualification. It's that way because that's what the structured compare editor needs. I can't add in the filename, because that's not available in the merge editor.

I need to figure out a solution that works in both structured compare and outline view.

issues.title: Copy&Paste duplicating imports
Bug in Extract Function
Broken inferred type
issues.body:
```
value p2 = `process`;
```

The hover popup says the type is `Value<process>` and "Reveal inferred types" codes and breaks my code by substituting this incorrect type.

issues.title: Backend errors cleaned out on workspace restart
issues.body:
This may be environment-related but the end result may be a bug.

Plugin is up-to-date with most recent jars, but SDK is from 16th and has not been re-compiled and only exists in `~/.ceylon/cache`.

MutableMap and MutableList errors occur as there are hierarchy problems due to recent changes in collections.  So, 13 back-end errors show up. Fine.

When the workspace is restarted, resets errors, initializes dependencies, runs the typechecker, and then does not re-instate the errors.

Project clean results in the errors coming back.

issues.title: string literals don't "escape" syntax highlighter in ceylon hover
issues.body: This is an easy one but a little time consuming: because I do the syntax highlighting for markdown code blocks displayed in the hover using regex, it's tricky to not apply the highlighting to keywords and type names occurring in string literals. So we need to do it using something better than regexes.

issues.title: Editing a package in ceylon.language causes unrelated projects to be rebuilt
issues.body:
When I edit a `package.ceylon` file in the `ceylon.language` project, it causes unrelated ceylon projects to get rebuilt. Perhaps this is limited to the `ceylon.language`, but we should make sure it's not general. I doubt we should rebuilt other projects unless they explicitly import this project (yes, project, not just modules defined in this project).

In Eclipse project dependencies are defined explicitly, not by whatever modules they contain and depend on.

issues.title: Error in default module causes entire project compilation to fail
issues.body:
A bug in a module won't prevent other modules from compiling, but a bug in single source files will! None of the modules in the project will compile.

But it can't be just any bug, it has to be a "duplicate declaration".

You can get this tiny Eclipse project that shows the problem
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/4103132/foobar.zip

File:

``` ceylon
import org.apache.camel.impl { DefaultCamelContext }
import org.apache.camel.component.jetty { JettyHttpComponent }
import org.apache.camel.builder { RouteBuilder }
import java.lang { Thread { currentThread } }

"Run the module `simple`."
shared void run() {
  print("Start Camel");
  value context = DefaultCamelContext();
  context.addComponent("jetty", JettyHttpComponent());
  object routeBuilder extends RouteBuilder() {
    shared actual void configure() {
      from("jetty:http://localhost:8080").log("got request");
    }
  }
  context.addRoutes(routeBuilder);
  context.start();
  currentThread().sleep(10000);
  print("Stop Camel");
}

```

issues.title: two issues with UI for project setup
issues.body:
I noticed two strange things with the project preferences:
1. On the Module Repositories page, the Add Repository... button opens up a popup that lets me select a workspace folder. First issue: the text on this popup is wrong. Second issue: what is this even for? For repos sitting inside a project in the Eclipse workspace?? Really?
2. On the main Ceylon page, there is a checkbox labelled Offline, which has three states, one of which I don't understand. I happen to know why Eclipse has three-state checkboxes and it's definitely not for this. Eclipse has this totally innovative new thing called a "ra-dio bu-tton" (pronounced like "la-zer") that you can use for this.

We should fix these minor issues before releasing.

issues.title: Rename dialog shows double the number of places affected
issues.body: The number the dialog show to tell you in how many places it will make changes is double the actual number (as seen for example in the preview)

issues.title: bug in Terminate Statement
issues.body:
Given

```
String()
print();
```

If I run Terminate Statement on the first line, I get rubbish (it should just add a semi).

issues.title: Correct Indentation works about maybe 80% of the time.
issues.body:
Seriously, what are we going to do about `CeylonAutoEditStrategy`. It kinda works. But at this point I'm too scared to touch it because it's really hard to fix one thing without breaking another.

There are a handful of tests for it in the class `com.redhat.ceylon.eclipse.code.editor.Test`, some of which are currently failing, because nobody (i.e. not me) ever runs them.

Is there some _better_ way to handle the problem of indenting code than this?

issues.title: use a proper lexer inside refactoring participants
issues.body: Currently we try to use regexes to parse Ceylon in the refactoring participants. This is a little crazy because we're actually looking at source files for which we have ASTs lying around. We can use the regex to identify candidate files, and then do it properly using the token stream or AST.

issues.title: Java class with package private constructor "does not exist"
'Fragile areas' errors cascade/trigger inter-module dependency error storm
issues.body:
This may be a repetition of existing issues, but here is the observation.  Any errors related to certain 'fragile' constructs (probably related to a common compiler pass) result in a number of unrelated errors related to the same 'fragile' areas -- especially where there is complicated inter-module dependency. Here are two examples - the first is only IDE error and s not reproducible with the command line compiler:

Fragile areas: annotations, aliases, package visbility across modules: any problem in these areas seems to affect all of these.  For example, an alias error will result in all annotations in one module not being accessible in the other module.  So, one unrelated alias error will result in all annotation definitions and usage being rendered as errors.

**Example 1: Recursive Alias (not compiler error, only in IDE)**

``` ceylon
shared alias Primitive => String | Integer | Float | Boolean;
shared alias Assocable => Primitive |Assoc|Array;
```

**Example 2: Module/package visibility**
- `module-api` has only one shared package and accesses the shared package in `module-core`. It contains annotations, aliases and interfaces
- `module-core` has one shared and one not-shared package
- `module-a`, `module-b` and `module-c` use annotations, aliases and interfaces defined in `module-api`

If type `AType` in the module-core/shared package depends on an import that is not shared, it is an error for the class in `module-api` that uses `AType`.  However, all annotations and alias chains will break across all modules, resulting in 100+ errors and the real error is hard to find.  Even when found, multiple clean cycles are required to rest the module after fixing the error.

I hope the extra detail helps to connect the dots.

issues.title: Unreported compiler errors
issues.body:
As reported in ceylon/ceylon-compiler#1187  the `CompileErrorReporter.report()` method is receiving a `diagnostic` whose source is a `RegularFileObject`, which it doesn't currently do anything with. 

This means that even though errors were logged by the compiler, they might not show up anywhere in the IDE.

issues.title: Build progress bar is broken
issues.body:
When I open the sdk project, the build progress bar goes up to 100% relatively fast, then it starts typechecking and I can see each file appear in the status as it goes (in the `Progress` view), and then it generates binaries (invokes the compiler), which stays stuck for a while on the first file, then moves on to the other files.

We should fix the progress bar so that it doesn't go to 100% until it's done compiling every file. We should also investigate why the progress status gets stuck a bit on the first compiled file.

See screenshot, it appears to think my ceylon99 module is infinitely contained in itself. Naturally the File System see it as flat and non-recursive. Refresh does nothing to restore sanity. I've seen it already in the past. It may have happened right after I copied/pasted this module from another project.

issues.title: Backend error hidden for invalid maven dependencies
issues.body:
ceylon/ceylon-compiler#1100 fails in the IDE with a nice `imported declaration not found: JettyHttpComponent` error, but the backend fails with errors such as:

```
error: Unable to find class file for org.eclipse.jetty.client.HttpClient
/home/stephane/src/java-eclipse/ceylon-tests/source/foo/run.ceylon:10: error: ExpressionVisitor caused an exception visiting BaseTypeExpression node: com.redhat.ceylon.compiler.loader.ModelResolutionException: Failed to resolve org.eclipse.jetty.client.HttpClient at com.redhat.ceylon.compiler.loader.AbstractModelLoader.convertToDeclaration(AbstractModelLoader.java:723)
  context.addComponent("jetty", JettyHttpComponent());
                                ^
```

I don't prefer the backend error, but it _is_ giving useful info (that we will improve) to resolve the issue, and it's not normal that we don't log it.

issues.title: Incremental build breaks frequently
issues.body:
When working on the SDK, practically any time I save a file. It will rebuild a ton of files and most of those will fail. I even got an error about a missing `ceylon.util` file that does not exist in the sdk and can only come from using an outdated repo or cache somewhere because the string can't be found in the sdk project.

It could be a combination/mix of jdt model or compiler bugs but we have to start investigating it from here. As it is the IDE is not really usable.

issues.title: Touching a file in the `ceylon.language` project triggers a full build of `ceylon-sdk`
issues.body: Even though it does not depend on it. It's not in its build path either.

issues.title: Test plugin does not notice it is stopped when running `test.ceylon.net` tests
issues.body: The tests do finish, but the test plugin desnn't notice it and stays stuck. Pressing the "stop" button has no effect visually because the code checks the test run and it is already finished.

issues.title: alignment of second line of multiline string literal when tabs are used
issues.body: When tabs are used instead of spaces, the IDE doesn't auto-align the second line of a multiline string literal when you type a newline.

issues.title: convert getter to method quick assis
issues.body:
`ConvertGetterToMethodProposal` has two problems:
1. it doesn't work in an unsaved editor, and
2. it doesn't handle getters defined using `=>`.

These issues should be straightforward to fix.

issues.title: Java launcher does not know about Ceylon modules runtime
issues.body:
The Java launcher cannot ATM initialiser the Ceylon modules runtime:

Given this Java code:

```
package foo;

import ceylon.language.String;

public class Java {
    public static void main(java.lang.String[] args) {
        check_.check(String.$TypeDescriptor$, String.instance("hello"));
    }
}
```

And this Ceylon:

```
shared Boolean check<T>(Anything o) => o is T;
```

I get the following error running `Java.main()` from the IDE:

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/redhat/ceylon/cmr/api/Logger
    at foo.check_.check(reified.ceylon:36)
    at foo.Java.main(Java.java:7)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.redhat.ceylon.cmr.api.Logger

    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:356)

```

issues.title: Typing ``
issues.body:
When the caret is inside a string literal and I want to start an interpolated expression I naturally want to type `` (that is, two backticks). When I type the first backtick the IDE 'helpfully' adds a three more, positioning the caret in the middle of them so I can start writing my expression. I then type the second backtick and the editor decides I must want to overtype the next backtick (that is, the third one aka the second one that it added automatically), leaving the caret between the third and forth backticks.

Personally I would find it much more natural if the editor only completed the `` when I actually type my second backtick, rather than on the first one. I'm assuming it's trying to prevent leaving the source code in an inparseable state. If it really must complete after the first one it should suppress the second of my backticks.

issues.title: Obsolete quoting rules for toplevel decls
issues.body: Now toplevel decls with lower case get suffixed with '_', and as a result they will never be the same as Java keywords anymore. So inside the JDTModelLoader, we shouldn't quote anymore keyword-like decls with $ in such cases.

issues.title: navigation to default and abstract is broken
issues.body: I suppose this is a result of the fact that we're now compiling the language module, or perhaps due to some other backend change, but ⌘-click navigation is broken for annotations with Java keyword names.

- move ceylon.io-0.5.car.idx to another location
- run from console an application that uses ceylon.io (because there is no .idx it is generated)
- looking at .idx file sizes, you can see that runtime generated is twice the size of exported

issues.title: Deadlock in warmup job
issues.body:
For some reason I've had this deadlock three times since yesterday, for absolutely no obvious reason (every time I noticed it only when it would not let me save the file because it's waiting on completion).

I used jvisualVM to get a thread dump and the culprit seems to be:

```

"Worker-172" prio=10 tid=0x00007fec74001000 nid=0x7b59 runnable [0x00007fed6a8f6000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
    at java.util.HashMap.getEntry(HashMap.java:364)
    at java.util.HashMap.containsKey(HashMap.java:352)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.compiler.loader.AbstractModelLoader.lookupClassMirror(AbstractModelLoader.java:200)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.compiler.loader.AbstractModelLoader.convertToDeclaration(AbstractModelLoader.java:602)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.eclipse.core.model.loader.JDTModelLoader.convertToDeclaration(JDTModelLoader.java:459)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.eclipse.core.model.loader.JDTModelLoader.loadPackage(JDTModelLoader.java:329)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.compiler.loader.model.LazyPackage.getMembers(LazyPackage.java:130)
    at com.redhat.ceylon.eclipse.core.builder.WarmupJob.run(WarmupJob.java:34)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:54)

   Locked ownable synchronizers:
    - None
```

That's very weird, because the thread is marked as running, doesn't own any lock and `containsKey` seems to just be hung.

Anyone has any idea how to debug that? I think this requires proper attention by everyone that can help, such as @quintesse and @tombentley as this essentially freezes the IDE.

issues.title: quick fixes/assists should respect a "canonical" order of annotations
issues.body: Currently all quick fixes and assists always put the annotations right at the start of the annotation list. This is sucky, since it results in stuff like `shared doc`, `throws (Exception) doc` and `default shared`. We should define a canonical order (`doc`, `throws`, `shared`, `abstract`, `actual`, `formal`, `default`, `variable`) and make sure that the IDE respects that.

issues.title: Disable dot-completion in strings
issues.body: Seriously, typing comments in `doc` annotations is painful as each dot typed brings a completion popup ;)

issues.title: doc hover in module/package descriptors
issues.body: We never see any kind of doc hover in module package descriptors.

issues.title: navigation to module/package descriptors
issues.body:
Navigation to module/package descriptors is now broken. This affects:
1. hyperlink navigation,
2. Open Selected Declaration, and
3. the doc hover.

issues.title: error highlighting flakiness
issues.body: The error highlighting that occurs while typing is now flakey, and we now often see "out of date" errors (which disappear when you save). We need to manage the ordering of the typecheck jobs in `CeylonParseController`.

issues.title: completion processor warm-up is unacceptable
issues.body: OK, so it was a mistake to do completion processor warm-up lazily. It needs to happen as part of the build process.

issues.title: autocompletion of module names in module import
issues.body:
So I have got autocompletion of module import names _almost_ working but:
- I get rubbish partial-module names appearing because `ModuleManager.getOrCreateModule()` is called from `TypeVisitor` and creates a rubbish `Module`
- there is no hover info
- of course, we still can't auto-complete the module version (I think we could probably list the module names and versions together in one proposal list).

AFAICT, the first problem requires a change to `ModuleManager`.

issues.title: New module/package should produce M4-style descriptors
issues.body: They are now still producing M3-style descriptors.

issues.title: Quick-fix for changing `=` into `:=` and vice-versa don't work
issues.body: They appear to just do nothing.

issues.title: Inline refactoring does not add needed imports
issues.body: Inline is broken w.r.t. imports.

issues.title: create in new unit quick fix does not handle imports very well
issues.body: See the TODO at CreateInNewUnitProposal:72. Also need to handle dupe types properly.

issues.title: Type weirdness
issues.body:
I have a `Method` type with several attributes and methods, but I can only access the full set of members in certain locations. As a method parameter all is fine, but when the `Method` value is declared in a `for` loop, I only get less members. This is so weird I did a video:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KTrJjWuzrB0&feature=youtu.be

issues.title: Reference imported Ceylon modules from Java code
issues.body: When writing some Ceylon code written in Java (hand-compiled) it's often necessary to reference imported Ceylon modules, for example to create a mutable collection. The IDE doesn't seem to allow that, and the imported Ceylon module will not result in visible types from the Java file. Note that this isn't the same thing as circular dependencies between Ceylon and Java code that have to be compiled at the same time. The imported module is already compiled so it's as simple as adding the `.car` file to the Java Editor's classpath.

issues.title: auto-add imports for anonymous function parameter types
issues.body: The unfinished bit of #146 is parameter types of anon functions generated for invocation completions.

issues.title: failure to init builder at startup
issues.body: Sometimes we get big stacktraces at startup when trying to init the classpathcontainer. Says that the workbench is not yet available.

issues.title: type hierarchy popup and units in external modules
issues.body: You can pull up a type hierarchy popup in a source file from an archive, but if you select anything, it doesn't take you there.

issues.title: incremental build of ceylon that depends on java is broken
issues.body: Apparently, incremental build of Ceylon code after a change to Java code used to work. It's broken now.

issues.title: assign to new local infers bad local name for toplevel methods
issues.body:
If I do assign to new local on the expression `decimal(10.0u)`, I get:

```
value decimal = decimal(10.0u);
```

Which causes a name clash.

issues.title: errors about missing dependencies display in problems view not in editor
issues.body: Something is erasing the error annotations relating to missing dependencies from the editor of `modules.ceylon`. So you only see them in the problems view, and very briefly in the editor when it first opens.

issues.title: at startup, project sometimes cannot find modules defined in project upon which it depends
issues.body: I sometimes have to run a clean build after the startup process completes in order to get a project to pick up the .car of another project it depends on.

issues.title: adding or modifying ceylon builder on a project results in multiple builds
issues.body: When you enable the Ceylon builder on a project, or modify the settings on the preferences page, the project gets rebuilt multiple times (at least twice). It would be much better if it was rebuilt just once.

issues.title: renaming a file in a dependent project
issues.body: When project `x` depends upon project `y`, and I rename `y/Y.ceylon` to `y/Z.ceylon`, `x/X.ceylon` gets rebuilt, but project `x`s model of `Y.ceylon` does not get rebuilt, so hyperlink-navigation still tries to take me to  `y/Y.ceylon` not `y/Z.ceylon`.

issues.title: Pretty often the build breaks
issues.body: And I get a ton of errors from the compiler while building. And all I can do to fix it is to do a clean build. Very easy to experience while working on the SDK. Now, the problem is that none of the errors make sense, but some of them are related to not being able to find one of the SDK modules (which is in the project itself so that's pretty nuts). It's hard to tell whether it's the IDE or the compiler to blame and I don't quite know how to figure that out. Suggestions welcome.

issues.title: memory leak on full builds
issues.body: So it seems to me that I have confirmed that memory does leak during full builds. It seems that the `Typechecker`s held by CeylonBuilder get gradually bigger. The totally weird thing about this is: shouldn't the _very first_ thing we do when we run a full build be to throw away the existing `Typechecker`s and start from scratch? Are they somehow picking up and reusing tree or model objects from previous builds?

issues.title: Errors displayed in language module source when different projects use different repos
issues.body: If I have two projects, one using the IDE's embedded repo, and one using my default repo, I get errors displayed in the language module source of one of the projects.

issues.title: Error with Java interop
issues.body:
While fixing #252 I added the following files in the `test` package:

`bugs.ceylon`:

``` java
import test { Foo { foo }}

void bugs(){
    foo<Integer>();
}
```

and `Foo.java`:

``` java
package test;

public class Foo {
    public static <T> T[] foo() {
        return null;
    }
}
```

The typechecker says this is fine, but when I compile it I get:

```
===================================
[         0] Starting Ceylon build on project : P/ceylon-tests
-----------------------------------
[         0] Incremental build of model
[         2] Incremental generation of class files...
             ...compiling 1 source files...
/home/stephane/src/java-eclipse/ceylon-tests/source/test/bugs.ceylon:5: error: cannot find symbol
    foo<Integer>();
    ^
  symbol:   class Foo
  location: package test
             ...binary generation FAILED
[        30] Updating model in referencing projects
[        36] Collecting dependencies
-----------------------------------
[        36] End Ceylon build on project : P/ceylon-tests
===================================
```

issues.title: autocompletion of members inherited by union types
issues.body:
A union type like `Float|Integer` can consist of types like `Float` and `Integer` that inherit different instantiations of the same invariant type, in this case `Scalar`. In that case we're _not_ allowed to invoke operations of the supertype like `magnitude`. But the stupid IDE still proposes them!

(Got bitten by this one in my talk last night.)

issues.title: performance when editing a package/module descriptor
issues.body: It's unacceptable. I believe there is a memory leak.

issues.title: errors displayed in source of module in repo
issues.body: I create a module with a dependency to `ceylon.file` in the IDE. Browsing to the source code of any unit in the module, I see lots of `method or attribute does not exist or is ambiguous` and `type declaration does not exist or is ambiguous` errors.

issues.title: Bug in model
issues.body:
In the IDE

``` java
class MyIdentifiable() satisfies Identifiable {}
```

results in

```
/Users/gavin/runtime-EclipseApplication-clean-demo/bugs/source/MyIdentifiableObject.ceylon:3: error: cannot find symbol
class MyIdentifiable() satisfies Identifiable {}
^
  symbol:   variable $Identifiable$impl
  location: class MyIdentifiable
```

But not in the compiler so it must be the IDE's model loader. This is from ceylon/ceylon-compiler#606
