issues.title: detect that a Unit is not editable
issues.body:
Currently we propose refactorings for declarations in binary archives. i.e. we helpfully suggest that you might like to rename `Object`, for example.

@davidfestal what is a reliable way to detect that a `Unit` isn't "read only"?

issues.title: search results don't take into account dirty editors
issues.body: `FindSearchQuery` looks only at the underlying files, not at input in dirty editors. It should _at least_ do special handling for the current editor.

issues.title: new attribute initializer parameter syntax
issues.body:
The IDE (Find References, Find Assignments, Rename) does not understand the new syntax for attribute initializer parameters.

Note: hyperlink navigation _does_ seem to understand it.

issues.title: Cross-project references and build seems broken
issues.body:
Corss-project references are not well-managed anymore.
This is pobably quite easy to fix.

issues.title: autocompletion doesn't work in parameter lists
issues.body: I can't use autocompletion to help me write default arguments.

issues.title: broke MoveDeclarationHandler, etc
issues.body: It doesn't work to cache the editor in the constructor! Should refactor the useful code out of the `Handler`.

issues.title: Quick-fix for adding missing initialiser parameters inserts them before the type parameters
issues.body:
Try the quick fix to add the initialiser params here:

``` java
class Foo<T>{}
```

It will generate:

``` java
class Foo()<T>{}
```

issues.title: refined member generated by IDE is simple attribute even for interfaces
issues.body: Interfaces can't have simple attributes, but we propose them.

issues.title: comprehension with characters
issues.body:
This compiles from the command line but not from the IDE:

```
print({for (x in {"hello", "world"}) for (c in x) c.uppercased});
```

See ceylon/ceylon-compiler#600.

issues.title: refining hash
issues.body:
When I try to refine `hash`, I get:

```
/Users/gavin/ceylon-sdk/file/source/ceylon/file/internal/ConcretePath.ceylon:105: error: hashCode() in ConcretePath cannot override hashCode() in Object
        return jpath.hash;
        ^
  return type long is not compatible with int
```

This error _only_ occurs in the IDE.

issues.title: npe while building
issues.body:
I get lots of the following error at every initial build, and often at other times, forcing me to do a full rebuild:

```
DeclarationVisitor caused an exception visiting MethodDeclaration node: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.util.Util.getResourceContentsAsByteArray(Util.java:1131)    
```

issues.title: memory leak
issues.body: I have to restart the IDE every so often since it not-so-gradually grinds to a halt, especially during full builds. We need to find what is hanging on to garbage (something in `CeylonBuilder`, most likely).

issues.title: attempting to autocomplete a package name adds a new package to the model
issues.body: If I type `import foo`, and pull up a list of proposals, I will always see a package named `foo` in the list of proposals after that.

issues.title: deleting and then readding a Java file results in flakiness
issues.body: If I have a Java class that a Ceylon unit is using, both in the same package, I can induce really flakey behavior by deleting and then readding the file.

issues.title: removing a declaration from a file does not remove the classfile
issues.body: When you remove a declaration from a compilation unit without actually deleting the file, the `.class` in the `JDTClasses` directory does not get removed. It didn't used to matter that garbage class files hung around, but now it does because the Java compiler sees them there and thinks the declaration still exists.

issues.title: Java static method not visible if it returns T[]
Open Ceylon Declaration lists Java declarations but then can't open them
issues.body:
Currently all the Java SDK stuff shows up in the Open Ceylon Declaration window, but if you choose one, nothing happens. Either:
1. we need to filter 'em out, or
2. we need to be able to navigate to the Java source from Open Ceylon Declaration.

Actually, personally I think it's kinda bad to fill up this window with all the legacy Java SDK stuff.

issues.title: open file at startup never gets parsed
issues.body: So _sometimes_, when I have an already-open file at startup, or when I open a file while the initial model building is happening, the file never winds up getting compiled. I need to type and/or close and reopen the file to trigger parsing.

issues.title: Package.getImportableDeclarations()
issues.body: `getImportableDeclarations()` does not return all the toplevel declarations in a package, which breaks autocompletion. (This is similar to the now-fixed issue with `Module.getAllPackages()`.

issues.title: import not working correctly
null check needed in CeylonLabelProvider.parameters()
issues.body: At line 477, we need to add `if (p!=null)`.

issues.title: Refactorings should use aliases from imports
issues.body: When defining an alias in an import statement, every refactoring will use the unaliased name, which is wrong because only the alias is visible.

issues.title: Exception on save

issues.title: Add required \i or \I on completed identifiers
issues.body: When completing stuff like `foo.value` (Ceylon keyword) or `foo.BAR` (upper-case name for a field), the IDE should insert the proper required `\i`. Similarly for lower-cased classes that should have `\I`.

issues.title: IllegalArgumentException: Null stream!
Add refined members does not include type parameter bounds
issues.body: When using the quickfix "add refined members" I get them but if they should contain type parameter bounds (given F of XXX) then they don't which causes them to show an error.

issues.title: Escaped identifiers show up as errors
issues.body:
The following snippet of code:

```
shared interface Attr {
    shared formal String \ivalue;
}
```

results in the following error in the editor:

```
no viable alternative at character '\'
```

the weird thing is it **always** appears on the first line of the file, no matter where the actual escaped identifier is located.

issues.title: List of code suggestions do not produce same results if typing fast or slow
Packages duplicated in default module
issues.body:
Both a Package and a LazyPackage are created for a package existing in the default module.
This leads to imports not found, since the imported elements are searched in the wrong package.

issues.title: Put focus in rename field on rename declaration
issues.body: The rename  declaration dialog should have the focus set in the name field.

issues.title: Bug in "add member function" quickfix
Add robustness to the ceylon launcher
issues.body: For example when build errors are in the project or on the element to start, popup a warning, etc ...

issues.title: All markers are added when doing incremental build
issues.body: All markers are added again when doing incremental build on only some ceylon files. So markers are multiplied until a new full build is triggered.

issues.title: Can't import Java file in other package
issues.body:
I have `com.foo.Ceylon.ceylon`:

``` java
import com.foo.impl { Java  }
```

And `com.foo.impl.Java.java`:

``` java
package com.foo.impl;

public class Java {}
```

And I get:

```
Multiple messages at this line.
    -imported declaration not found: Java
    -member alias list must follow a type
```

issues.title: Editor flickers when doing nothing
issues.body: Often I have to wait for minutes for the IDE to stop flickering after I open a file.

issues.title: Can't use `import ceylon.language`
issues.body: Apparently the IDE doesn't let me do `import ceylon.language { topprint = print }` and says it can't find that package.

issues.title: indentation does not work
issues.body:
Hi,

Eclipse Version: 3.7.2 Build id: M20120208-0800
Ceylon IDE  1.0.0.v20120110-1110-M1
Windows 7

Indentation does not work automatically.

Hitting CTRL-I on un-indented code does nothing.

If I highlight some code that I have indented "manually", and then hit CTRL-I then the indentation is removed.

Apologies if this is a duplicate of https://github.com/ceylon/ceylon-ide-eclipse/issues/108 but it seemed like a different issue to me.

issues.title: Make key bindings platform-dependent
issues.body: @davidfestal should make a list of key bindings for Linux so that they are used if running on Linux. Similarly we'll need to make that list and change for Windows.

issues.title: Use binary classes instead of loading from source every module
issues.body:
Currently the IDE typechecks every dependent module, including those we don't need to typechecker because we're not editing them and we have their compiled representation.
- The IDE should avoir typechecking modules that are not editable and for whom no editor window is currently opened, and use the model loader instead to avoid unnecessary computation and use lazy model loading
- If the user opens a dependent source file for which we didn't do typechecking yet, then we run the typechecker against this module and replace the lazy model with its produced model.
  -- Unless we find a way to make this smarter with indexes for source lookup, searching and usage references, like JDT

issues.title: Make the IDE faster
issues.body: David seems to have done lots of progress on this, so we need to check that this gets resolved.

issues.title: Need better error messages when build fails
issues.body:
I'm trying to run my Ceylon file and I get the following:

```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/redhat/ceylon/compiler/java/test/interop/testURL
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.redhat.ceylon.compiler.java.test.interop.testURL
    at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
    at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
    at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
    at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)
Could not find the main class: com.redhat.ceylon.compiler.java.test.interop.testURL.  Program will exit.
```

Not sure what the real issue is, but in any case a more helpful error message would be nice. I'm also going to guess that you're not using the `ceylon-runtime` that deals with dependencies and stuff (though that's probably not the issue here).

This was due to bugs in four projects, but in any case, the error message should be "compilation failed because of internal error, here are the stack traces".

issues.title: Generated actual method missing type constraints
issues.body: When we generate code to refine a method, we don't generate type constraints on type arguments.

issues.title: Launcher should filter out abstract classes
issues.body: Classes annotated `abstract` appear in the launcher. They should not.

issues.title: Strange editor behavior for switch with multiple cases
issues.body: Something funny going on with the node lookup stuff for a switch statement.

issues.title: "Clean Project" does not remove modules/default/*
Infrastructure for automatically adding imports
issues.body: We already have a quick fix that automatically adds an import if you already have the whole type name. We need to make this a bit more general, so that it can be reused from autocompletion and from stuff like the Create Subtype wizard and create toplevel declaration quick fix.

issues.title: Closing and reopening outline view fails
issues.body: There's some kind of bug in IMP here. Apparently you're not supposed to reuse `LableProvider`s across multiple instantiations of the Outline view. Needs to be fixed in IMP, AFAICT. For now I worked around by disabling the close button on the Outline view in the Ceylon perspective.

issues.title: Add only correct module versions to classpath in Run > Ceylon Application
issues.body:
Currently `Run > Ceylon Application` adds _all_ versions of all modules in the repo to the classpath. It should only add the versions specified in the module descriptor of explicitly specified dependent modules.

@alesj  is this something that `ceylon-module-resolver` can help with?

issues.title: Visibility issues in auto-completion
issues.body: When I am inside a class `X` and I invoke autocompletion on the following: `X().` to see the list of members of that class (the surrounding class), I only see `shared` members, even though I am inside the class so I'm allowed to call non-`shared` members.

issues.title: Don't copy .ceylon files to the output dir
issues.body:
JDT automatically copies all non-`.java` files to the output dir unless you explicitly configure a filter. This plays havoc with the debugger. You can work around using:

```
Eclipse > Preferences > Java > Compiler > Building > Output folder > Filtered resources
```

But can we somehow avoid this configuration step?

issues.title: Breakpoints in control structures
issues.body:
We need to properly test/bugfix all the places you could put a breakpoint in a control structure. I have already noticed the following bugs:
1. a breakpoint on the condition of an `if` statement
2. a breakpoint in a `catch` block of a `try` statement

There could easily be others.

issues.title: Ceylon classpath containers should be exported by default

issues.title: NPE when debugging is some Ceylon source code with the Expressions View opened

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #1301 : Check for obsolete filtered Java source archives.

#1301 : use cached filtered source archives that do not contain Ceylon
source file.

issues.body:
When debugging a Ceylon source file, if the Expressions View is opened and contains Java watches, this triggers a NPE with an error popup : 

```
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.SourceBasedSourceGenerator.getTypeName(SourceBasedSourceGenerator.java:783)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.SourceBasedSourceGenerator.buildMethodDeclaration(SourceBasedSourceGenerator.java:478)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.SourceBasedSourceGenerator.buildBody(SourceBasedSourceGenerator.java:419)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.SourceBasedSourceGenerator.buildTypeBody(SourceBasedSourceGenerator.java:360)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.SourceBasedSourceGenerator.buildTypeDeclaration(SourceBasedSourceGenerator.java:645)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.SourceBasedSourceGenerator.endVisit(SourceBasedSourceGenerator.java:1088)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.TypeDeclaration.accept0(TypeDeclaration.java:473)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTNode.accept(ASTNode.java:2711)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTNode.acceptChildren(ASTNode.java:2782)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.CompilationUnit.accept0(CompilationUnit.java:212)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTNode.accept(ASTNode.java:2711)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.EvaluationSourceGenerator.createEvaluationSourceFromSource(EvaluationSourceGenerator.java:152)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.EvaluationSourceGenerator.getSource(EvaluationSourceGenerator.java:233)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.ASTEvaluationEngine.getCompiledExpression(ASTEvaluationEngine.java:319)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.ASTEvaluationEngine.evaluate(ASTEvaluationEngine.java:131)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaWatchExpressionDelegate$EvaluationRunnable.run(JavaWatchExpressionDelegate.java:142)
    at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread$ThreadJob.run(JDIThread.java:3158)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:54)
```

In fact the problem is that JDT doesn't look at the source file name to be sure this is Java code. and it tries to evaluate the watch expressions against the Ceylon source code, thinking it is Java code.
Since this pre-requisites are not met, finally a NPE is thrown.

It seems that the very root cause of this is that the Stratum in which the source file name and lines are added is the default stratum (ie. the Java stratum). This was also the real root cause of #1254.

@quintesse, @FroMage, @tombentley : Sometimes I think that, to avoid such bad surprises in the future, we should have used a `Ceylon` stratum to generate the `source name`, `source path` and all the debug information in the class files generated from Ceylon sources (and of course set the default stratum to `Ceylon` for those files).
See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/jdk/api/jpda/jdi/com/sun/jdi/Location.html and https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/jdk/api/jpda/jdi/com/sun/jdi/ReferenceType.html#defaultStratum() for reference information about that.

This would be the best way to solve this issue.

- If I make `test()` shared I can run it. If I then make is non-shared I can _still_ run it via **Run > Run History > ...**. I should get the same response as when I try to run it directly.
- If I add a non-defaulted parameter to `test()` (it's shared again now) then and I try to run it not via history I get the same dialog.
- But if I run it out of the history again then I get an error message in the dialog:
  
  > ceylon run: Cannot run toplevel method 'jsonsl.test': it should have no
  >   parameters or they should all have default values.
  
  But this message doesn't mention the need for `shared`!

```
import ceylon.html {
    Html,
    html5,
    Head,
    Body,
    P
}
import ceylon.html.serializer {
    NodeSerializer
}
import ceylon.net.http.server {
    createServer,
    Endpoint,
    startsWith,
    Response,
    Request
}

Html html(Request request) {
    return Html {
        doctype = html5; 
        Head { title = "Hello"; }; 
        Body {
            P("Hello!")
        };
    };
}

shared void runit() {
    createServer {
        Endpoint { 
            path = startsWith("/"); 
            void service(Request request, Response response) {
                NodeSerializer(response.writeString).serialize(html(request));

        }
    }.start();
}

issues.title: Step filtering for certain language module methods
issues.body:
When debugging something such as

```
f(1); // where the argument is boxed
```

if I "step into" when on that line, I first step into `Integer.instance()`, which is not helpful: I really don't care about how the `int` is boxed. Eclipse has "Java > Debug > Step Filtering" which seems to be a way to avoid stepping into certain classes, packages etc.

We should have a list of classes/methods which are filtered like this. All the boxing and unboxing methods are obvious candidates, and I'm sure there will be others.

The specified method "hello$testable" does not exist or is not shared in the testable/1.0.0 module
```

trying to run `hello()`.

Launch from Tab as JS is implicitly available, but not hooked up to shortcut yet.  Need to test with JS semantics before activating.

issues.body: And similar for the JVM runner I guess.

issues.title: Allow Run As Ceylon Module on single files and on default module
issues.body:
Right clicking on a single .ceylon file within a module should still give you the option "Run As Ceylon Module" but only show the toplevel declarations that exist within that file (this is already done in "Run As Ceylon Application" so that could just be copied I guess).

Single files that are not within an explicit module folder are still part of the implicit "default" module and should therefore be executable with "Run As Ceylon Module" as well.

Want to take a look at this as well @akberc ? :)

issues.title: Confusing line number debug info
issues.body:
It appears the compiler is generating code with line number information for overload methods (i.e. those which add a default parameter value, and then call the next overloaded method). 

This is a good thing because we need some way to debug the default value expressions. 

But currently it is confusing as we seem to enter the same method repeatedly, with no obvious indication that we're evaluating the defaulted method parameters (you _can_ tell, by looking at the stack in the debug view, but that's not at all obvious, and you have to know how we munch method names to make any sense of it). So it there was some we we could indicate what's going on to the user, that would be nice.

issues.title: Mouse over is not showing variable value while debuging
issues.body:
In Eclipse/Java while debuging, you can view varable value by moving a mouse over a variable.
Missing this in Ceylon.

issues.title: Debug cursor is jumping around
issues.body: While debuging cursor is not showing the right lines.

issues.title: Ceylon-oriented views in the debugger
issues.body: Show the ceylon form of the variables, and the ceylon stacktrace, instead of the java view of all the debug infos.

issues.title: Run using the module runtime
issues.body:
Add a `Run > As Ceylon Module` option that runs the current module using the new module runtime.

Note that we still need the old `Run > As Ceylon Application`, because it lets us run any arbitrary toplevel method easily without needing module descriptors, etc.

issues.title: Breakpoints in control structures
issues.body:
We need to properly test/bugfix all the places you could put a breakpoint in a control structure. I have already noticed the following bugs:
1. a breakpoint on the condition of an `if` statement
2. a breakpoint in a `catch` block of a `try` statement

There could easily be others.
